summary: The Matterhorn is a huge mountain in the Alps, between Italy and Switzerland. It's famous for its pyramid shape and four steep faces. People have been studying it since the 1700s, but it was first climbed in 1865. Over 500 people have died trying to climb it. It's made of special rocks and formed by ice over time. The Matterhorn is like a symbol of the Alps and attracts many visitors. Today, people still climb it, mostly using a route called the HÃ¶rnli ridge.
title: Matterhorn
